name: Valheim Dedicated Server
author: michaelcrow@restoremonarchy.com

installation.script:
apt update
apt -y --no-install-recommends install curl libgdiplus lib32gcc1 ca-certificates

cd /tmp
curl -sSL -o steamcmd.tar.gz https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz

mkdir -p /mnt/server/steam
tar -xzvf steamcmd.tar.gz -C /mnt/server/steam
cd /mnt/server/steam

chown -R root:root /mnt

export HOME=/mnt/server
./steamcmd.sh +@sSteamCmdForcePlatformBitness 64 +login anonymous +force_install_dir /mnt/server +app_update 896660 validate +quit

cat <<"EOT" > /mnt/server/start_server.sh
export templdpath=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=./linux64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
export SteamAppId=892970

# Tip: Make a local copy of this script to avoid it being overwritten by steam.
# NOTE: Minimum password length is 5 characters & Password cant be in the server name.
# NOTE: You need to make sure the ports 2456-2458 is being forwarded to your server through your local router & firewall.

# STOP: DO NOT EDIT THIS LINE, GO TO THE "Startup" TAB AND MODIFY VARIABLES THERE
./valheim_server.x86_64 -name "${SERVER_NAME}" -port 2456 -world "${SERVER_WORLD_NAME}" -password "${SERVER_PASSWORD}" -public ${SERVER_PUBLIC} > server.log 2>&1 &
# STOP: DO NOT EDIT THIS LINE, GO TO THE "Startup" TAB AND MODIFY VARIABLES THERE
echo "Server started"
echo "Type 'stop' to stop server"

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$templdpath

last_line=''
while :
do
    if  [[ "$last_line" != $(tail -3 server.log | grep .) ]]
    then
    	last_line=$(tail -3 server.log | grep .)
        echo "$last_line"
    fi
    read -t 0.01 key
    if [[ $key = 'quit' ]] || [[ $key = 'close' ]] || [[ $key = 'exit' ]] || [[ $key = 'stop' ]]
    then
    	echo 1 > server_exit.drp
        break
    fi
done


echo "Server exit signal set"
echo "You can now close this terminal"
exit 0
EOT

variables.name: Valheim Auto Update
variables.description: Input 1 to enable or 0 to disable

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: Name of the server as it should appear on Steam server browser

variables.name: World Name
variables.description: Name of the world file to load / generate (exclude file extension). World can be found nested in the /.config folder

variables.name: Public server
variables.description: Should the server appear publicly on server browser

variables.name: Server Password
variables.description: Password required for users to join
